events.message: The policyholder reported a vehicle collision on the morning of April 15th, involving significant damage to the front bumper and airbags deployed.
The reported claim has been categorised under Auto Accident after confirming the presence of keywords related to a car collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to the auto accident claim to handle all subsequent communications and investigations.
The policyholder was promptly informed that their auto accident claim has been received and is under review.
The agent requested the policyholder submit the accident report, photographs of the vehicle damage, and the police report for further processing.
All requested documents including the police report and pictures of the damaged car were received from the policyholder on April 17th.
The claim investigation commenced with an inspector reviewing the submitted proofs and scheduling an on-site vehicle inspection.
The vehicle inspection was completed confirming the extent of damages consistent with the reported collision incident.
A settlement amount covering repair costs and additional expenses was proposed to the policyholder for approval.
The policyholder responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the handling of their claim.
The claim was approved after final review based on the investigation outcomes and customer agreement on the settlement offer.
Insurance payment covering the approved settlement amount was issued to the policyholder to facilitate repairs and recovery.
The auto accident claim was formally closed after confirming the payment receipt and completion of repair work.
